subject: Travel
title: Why Planes Are Safer Than Cars
description: A micro-lesson that makes Why Planes Are Safer Than Cars usable.

hook.text: Your odds of dying in a plane crash are about 1 in 11 million. Driving to the airport is more dangerous.

buildup.text: Modern jets have triple-redundant systems. If one fails, two backups take over instantly.

discovery.text: Every crash is investigated exhaustively. Lessons are turned into mandatory fixes for all airlines.

twist.text: Fear of flying affects 25% of people. Yet statistically, 2023 had zero fatal jet crashes worldwide.

climax.text: You'd need to fly every day for 22,000 years to be statistically likely to die in a crash.

punchline.text: Flying is terrifying to some and safer than almost everything.

quiz.question: What are the odds of dying in a plane crash?
